1.Title: Raspberry Beignets with Vanilla Dipping Sauce
1.Show: The Best Thing I Ever Made

Beignets.1: In a medium bowl, stir together the yeast and the water. Set aside to proof.
Beignets.2: After 10 minutes, stir in the all-purpose flour, cover with plastic, set aside in a warm place and let it double in size.
Beignets.3: In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream together the butter and sugar, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the eggs, with the mixer on low speed, one by one. When the mix is smooth, add the vanilla and salt. Stir to blend. Add the bread flour and mix on low speed until fully incorporated.
Beignets.4: Change the electric mixer attachment to a dough hook. Continue mixing the dough until it becomes a ball. Then, stir in the yeast mixture until thoroughly incorporated. Put the dough in a bowl, cover with plastic and allow to proof, 1 hour to 1 hour 30 minutes.
Beignets.5: Lightly flour a cool surface and roll the dough out to about 1 1/2-inch thickness. Cut rounds of dough with a cutter and turn them onto a floured baking sheet to rest, 20 to 30 minutes, before frying.
Beignets.6: Heat the oil in a large pot to 365 to 370 degrees F. Drop the beignets in the hot fat and cook until golden brown on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove them from the oil with a slotted spoon. Poke the pastry tip into the side of each beignet to inject some of the raspberry jam into the center of each and roll in the granulated sugar. Serve immediately with Vanilla Dipping Sauce.

Vanilla Dipping Sauce Directions.1: In a medium saucepan, bring the cream and milk to a simmer and add the vanilla beans.
Vanilla Dipping Sauce Directions.2: In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until they become a pale yellow color, 3 to 5 minutes. When the milk/cream simmers, pour it gently over the egg yolks and whisk to blend. Pour the entire mixture back into the pot and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, until the mixture thickens slightly, 5 to 8 minutes. The sauce should register about 170 degrees F on a thermometer and still be smooth. Strain into a bowl, stir in the vanilla and allow to cool slightly before refrigerating.

Directions.1: Combine all and simmer, stir often, 4 hrs.
Microwave cream cheese until softened (20% power).
Directions.2: Beat electric mixer until smooth.
Directions.3: Add brown sugar and powdered sugar, mix until smooth.
Directions.4: Blend milk and vanilla.
Directions.5: Add milk for desired consistency.

12.Title: Taco Seasoning
12.Author: BILL ECHOLS
12.Description: A mixture of spices that approximates what you might buy in a package. Depending on how spicy you and your family like your dishes, use as little or as much as you want.

Directions.1: In a small bowl, mix together chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, red pepper flakes, oregano, paprika, cumin, salt and pepper. Store in an airtight container.

13.Title: Dip in Bread

Directions.1: Combine all ingredients except bread. To prepare bread, cut off top 1/8th of loaf.
Directions.2: Remove bread from center (but save for dipping) and leave about a 1 inch shell on sides and bottom.
Directions.3: Put dip ingredients into hollowed out bread shell.
Directions.4: Wrap in foil and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Description: Use kitchen shears to snip parsley. Measure after snipping.
Can also use kitchen shears on dried beefâ€”cut into strips, then in 1/2 inch pieces.
13.Comments: A friend brought us this bread as a Christmas gift many years ago. We were so hungry when it arrived that we just ripped into it like animals! After we'd devoured it, we found the directions written on the cardâ€”heat for 1 hr.! So we always heat it now, but if you're really hungryâ€¦â€¦. Mrs. G.

14.Title: Baked Spinach Dip Loaf
14.Description: Any round loaf works as a serving bowl for this cream-cheesy dip, with spinach, cheddar, water chestnuts and, yes, bacon. Scoop the dip with the extra bread and veggiesâ€”then eat the bowl! â€”Frieda Meding, Trochu, Alberta

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 375°. Reserve 1 tablespoon crumbled bacon for topping. Beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in spinach, water chestnuts, 1 cup cheese, half of the green onions, garlic, seasonings and remaining bacon.
Directions.2: Cut a 1-1/2-in. slice off top of bread. Hollow out the bottom, leaving a 1/2-in.-thick shell. Cut all removed bread into cubes for serving. Fill shell with dip. Wrap in heavy-duty foil, tenting foil over dip. Bake on a baking sheet 1-1/4 hours.
Directions.3: Open foil carefully, allowing steam to escape. Sprinkle dip with remaining cheese and green onion and the reserved bacon. Bake until cheese is melted, 10-15 minutes. Serve warm with cucumber and cubed bread.

15.Title: Slow-Cooker Hot Artichoke and Spinach Dip

Directions.1: In 1- to 1 1/2-quart slow cooker, mix all ingredients except bread.
Directions.2: Cover; cook on Low heat setting 2 to 4 hours. Serve dip with sliced bread.

16.Description: This hearty combination is the ultimate comfort food.
16.Title: Ham-and-Bean Soup

Ham Soup.1: Sort and wash beans. Place beans in a 6-quart Dutch oven; add water 2 inches above beans, and soak 8 hours. Drain.
Ham Soup.2: Sauté ham, onion, and garlic in hot oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat 5 minutes or until onion is tender.
Ham Soup.3: Add beans, ham bone, chicken broth, and red pepper. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer, stirring occasionally, 1 1/2 hours or until beans are tender and soup has thickened.

Cornbread Croutons.1: Prepare 1 recipe (enough for 6 servings) cornbread mix according to package directions.
Cornbread Croutons.2: Cut baked cornbread into 1-inch squares, brush with melted butter, and place on a baking sheet.
Cornbread Croutons.3: Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Directions.1: Brown ground beef slowly in a little hot fat in a heavy kettle. Add onions and cook 5 min. more.
Directions.2: Add remaining ingredients except tomatoes and mix thoroughly, loosening the brown crustiness from bottom of kettle.
Directions.3: Bring to boil; cover, then simmer 20 min.
Directions.4: Add tomatoes and, if necessary, more water; simmer 10 min. longer. 2 generous servings.

Directions.1: Mix and shape meatballs.
Directions.2: Dissolve and pour over meatballs.
Directions.3: Bake at 300°F for 1 hour.

Directions.1: In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs, sugar, pumpkin and oil until smooth.
Directions.2: Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt; add to pumpkin mixture and mix well.
Directions.3: Fold in chocolate chips.
Directions.4: Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups 3/4 full.
Directions.5: Bake at 400 degrees for 16-20 minutes or until muffins test done.
Directions.6: Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

2.Title: Exquisite Pizza Sauce
2.author: Angie Gorkoff
2.Description: This sauce is wonderfully flavorful and is worth adding in the numerous ingredients.

Directions.1: In a small bowl, combine tomato paste, water, Parmesan cheese, garlic, honey, anchovy paste, onion powder, oregano, marjoram, basil, ground black pepper, cayenne pepper, red pepper flakes and salt; mix together, breaking up any clumps of cheese.
Directions.2: Sauce should sit for 30 minutes to blend flavors; spread over pizza dough and prepare pizza as desired.

20.Title: Should Be Illegal Oven BBQ Ribs

Directions.1: Place all ingredients together in large roasting pan (I use bottom of turkey roaster).
Directions.2: Cut ribs apart for easier serving.
Directions.3: Mix together making sure to coat all ribs with this semi-dry paste.
Directions.4: Spread ribs out evenly on bottom of pan.
Directions.5: Cover lightly with foil.
Directions.6: Bake at 375 degrees for approximately 1 hour.
Directions.8: You can use broiler for these ribs, just watch more closely, and adjust cooking time as needed.
Directions.9: These ribs are also great finished on the grill for a few minutes on each side.

Description: I have made this recipe many times to get rave reviews and licked the platter clean! The only alteration I make is slow-cook the ribs at 325 degrees for about 3 hrs. This seems to allow the flavors more time to permeate the meat plus makes for ribs which melt in your mouth.

Now I know why this is so popular. These are simply terrific. I followed the recipe with 2 exceptions: slow cooked @ 325 for 3 hours and I did not use white sugar, I used 1/4 cup honey instead. I used some of the sweetness of the brown sugar and honey. Thank you Beverly.

Excellent ribs. We like our ribs sweet & sticky and falling off the bones. I couldn't find Old Bay Seasoning (I'm from Canada) so I made my own from a recipe I found on the internet. I only used 1/2 the amount of garlic powder, omitted the white sugar and cooked for 3 hours in the oven very slow. Served them with baked potato and baked squash with a green salad to start.

I'll join the bandwagon--these are great! I also cooked them very slow--a little over 3 hours at 300°. Don't usually use Old Bay Seasoning so did some research and found a copycat recipe on foodtv.com and made a small amount of 'Old Bay' just for this.

Great recipe, this was the first time I ever made ribs. I cooked them in the crockpot, on low for about 4 hours and on high for another 1 1/2 to 2 hours and they still came out very tender and juicy. This recipe is a keeper. UPDATE: 2nd time I'm using this recipe with 5

Delicious slow cooked. We reheated the left overs in the oven, and they were as good as the first time. We put the left over sauce in jars and froze it, to recycle, as it uses a lot of honey and bbq sauce, and it seems a waste to just throw it out.

I am not a BBQ fan, but this recipe really turn me around. I left the recipe intact, but used 2 cloves of finely chopped garlic instead of garlic powder, omitted the white sugar and cooked for half an hour longer (still cover). The leftover sauce smell wonderful, so I save it.
This was fantastic. I cooked it for 2 1/2 hours at 325 degrees and they were fall off the bone tender. There were three of us and we ate, and ate and ate....delish! Thanks for sharing too.

Boil and pour over.Note: used 3 tablespoons of Mexican vanilla for double recipe

Directions.1: Place mixture on cookie sheet.
Directions.2: Bake at 300 degrees for 30 min.
Directions.3: Stir every 10 min.
Directions.4: Add dried fruit - Cranberries

Directions.1: In small bowl, combine cornstarch, sugar and bouillon granules; blend well. Stir in remaining sauce ingredients; set aside.
Directions.2: Cook fusilli to desired doneness as directed on package. Drain; rinse with hot water. Keep warm.
Directions.3: In large skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Stir-fry zucchini, summer squash and red pepper 2 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Remove from pan. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil; add chicken. Stir-fry 5 minutes or until chicken is tender and no longer pink. Add sauce and vegetables; cook until thoroughly heated and slightly thickened, stirring occasionally. Serve over cooked fusilli. Sprinkle with basil. (4 1/2-cup) servings.

Microwave Directions.1: Prepare fusilli as directed above. Place chicken in 9-inch microwave-safe glass pie pan. Cover with waxed paper. Microwave on HIGH for 5 to 6 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink, stirring once halfway through cooking. Drain; set aside. Keep warm.
Microwave Directions.2: Place vegetables in 3-quart microwave-safe bowl. Omit oil. Cover with microwave-safe plastic wrap. Microwave on HIGH for 3 1/2 to 4 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring once halfway through cooking. Keep warm.
Microwave Directions.3: In 2-cup glass measure, combine cornstarch, sugar and bouillon granules; blend well. Stir in remaining sauce ingredients. Microwave on HIGH for 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 minutes, stirring with wire whisk after first minute and then after every 30 seconds until thickened. Add chicken and sauce to vegetables; toss to coat. Serve over cooked fusilli. Sprinkle with basil.

Boil and pour over.Note: used 3 tablespoons of Mexican vanilla for double recipe

Directions.1: Place mixture on cookie sheet.
Directions.2: Bake at 300 degrees for 30 min.
Directions.3: Stir every 10 min.
Directions.4: Add dried fruit - cranberries.

Directions.1: Spray a 9x13" glass casserole dish with cooking spray.
Directions.2: Set aside.
Directions.3: Cook the pasta according to package directions, in a large pot.
Directions.4: Drain, rinse, and return to the large pot.
Directions.5: Set aside.
Directions.6: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Directions.7: Add the flour, and cook until bubbly (about a minute).
Directions.8: Add the milk slowly, stirring after each addition and cook until slightly thickened.
Directions.9: Add the cream cheese, again stirring until completely melted.
Directions.12: Carefully pour the cream cheese mixture over the pasta, stirring gently to combine.
Directions.13: Add the shredded cheddar cheese, stirring to combine.
Directions.14: Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dish, top with bread crumbs if desired, and bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

25.Title: California Pizza Kitchen Pizza Dough
25.author: Pain au Chocolat
25.description: Years ago, in finer times, the California Pizza Kitchen website listed their recipes for pizza dough and tomato sauce. Unfortunately they've long since removed that particular content, but not before yours truly could write down the recipe. FAIR WARNING - This is an overnight pizza dough. It can be used day-of, but the difference in flavor is staggering.

Directions.1: Dissolve the yeast in the water and let it proof for 5 to 10 minutes. The yeast should have a little island of fizz/bubbles before you start. (if you're using instant yeast dissolve it in the water and skip the proof).
Directions.2: In a separate bowl mix all of the dry ingredients and create a little well in the middle. Dump your yeast mixture and the olive oil into the well and stir with either your fingers or a wooden spoon.
Directions.3: Once a lumpy kind of dough forms lightly oil your hands and start to knead the ball. Knead it for at least 5 minutes, until the dough is smooth but slightly tacky.
Directions.4: Lightly coat the ball in olive oil and place in an airtight container, allow to rise at room temperature for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Directions.5: You can use the dough at this point, but for a finer texture and a nice, mellow sort of tang do the following: Deflate the dough, bunch it back up into a ball, put it back into the container, and stow it in your refrigerator overnight.
Directions.6: About 2 hours before you're going to make your pizza remove the dough from the refrigerator, deflate again, and split into 2 equal portions. Roll both portions into balls, sealing any cracks as tightly as possible. Place the new dough balls on opposite sides of a shallow dish and cover with plastic wrap. Let them sit at room temperature for the aforementioned 2 hours (they'll be much easier to shape).
Directions.7: Heat your pizza stone (or the floor of your oven with both racks taken out) to 500 degrees F.
Directions.8: Roll out your dough balls, top them, and slide them into the oven using a cornmeal-dusted pizza peel (or anything smooth and thin enough to maneuver, like a cutting board).
Directions.9: Your pizzas will cook very quickly, so it's easier to just eyeball their progress than try to time them.

Ingredients.Cajun Seasoning: to taste (some are spicier than others)

Directions.1: In a large cast iron skillet, over medium high heat, brown the chicken and sausage until browned and cooked through. Place chicken and sausage on a plate.
Directions.2: Make the Roux in the same skillet by adding the fat and flour over medium heat, stirring constantly, until dark brown color.
Directions.3: Add the Holy Trinity – celery, onions and green bell peppers – and cook for 5 minutes, stirring and scraping the bottom of the pan.
Directions.4: Add bay leaves, salt and Cajun seasoning, chicken stock, sausage and chicken and cook for 30 minutes.
Directions.5: Add okra and reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes, or until okra is tender.
Directions.6: Serve over rice with a scoop of rice, gumbo and top with chopped green onions.

Directions.1: Cook spaghetti, drain, and add to chicken mixture.
Directions.2: Combine all ingredients, but reserve 4 ounces of cheese.
Directions.3: Toss to coat after spaghetti is in.
Directions.4: Place in greased 9x13 dish.
Directions.5: Sprinkle with 4 ounces cheese.
Directions.6: Bake uncovered at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.

Directions.1: Combine all ingredients and chill for at least 1 hour.
Directions.2: Blend in food processor or blender. Makes 3 cups.

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray bottom only of 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Directions.2: Beat butter in large bowl with an electric mixer set at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add granulated sugar and brown sugar; beat well. Add egg, egg whites and vanilla; beat until well blended. Add mashed banana, and beat on high speed 30 seconds.
Directions.3: Combine flour, baking soda, salt and baking powder in medium bowl. Add flour mixture to butter mixture alternately with cream, ending with flour mixture. Add walnuts to batter; mix well.
Directions.4: Pour batter evenly into prepared loaf pan. Bake<u> until browned and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean, about 1 hour 15 minutes.
Directions.5: Cool bread in pan on wire rack 10 minutes. Remove bread from pan; cool completely on wire rack. Slice and serve with butter and jam.

3.Title: Rolled Oats Granola
3.Description: You can make minor adjustments to the recipe based on what your body needs. Want extra energy for that big presentation? Double the nuts and halve the oats. Have a big run or game coming up? Bump up the honey or maple. And feel free to swap in your favorite nuts â€” I love walnuts, but pecans or almonds kill it, too.

Directions.1: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F.
Directions.2: In a medium mixing bowl, combine your oats, shredded coconut, walnuts, protein, and salt and stir well.
Directions.3: In a small mixing bowl, stir together the maple syrup and oil, then add the eggs and whisk until smooth.
Directions.4: Pour the maple syrup mixture into the oat mixture and stir to coat well.
Directions.5: Spread the mixture evenly onto a large parchment paper-lined baking sheet and bake in the oven, stirring every 5 minutes or so, until evenly golden brown and some epic clusters have formed. It will take about 15 to 20 minutes.
Directions.6: Let cool completely. (It keeps in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.)
Directions.7: Eat as is, or serve with yogurt, milk, or your favorite fruit!

Directions.1: Drain any liquid from yogurt.
Directions.2: Whip first 3 ingredients.
Directions.3: Stir in zest.
Directions.4: Layer with blueberries.

31.Title: White Bean-and-Pork Chili
31.Description: Our white chili gets its spice from green chiles, brightness from lime juice, and luscious texture from the last-minute addition of shredded cheese.

Directions.1: Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high. Add pork, and cook, stirring until crumbled and no longer pink, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain pork, and set aside. Wipe Dutch oven clean.
Directions.2: Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in Dutch oven over medium. Add onion, poblano, garlic, green chiles, cumin, and salt, and cook, stirring often, until vegetables are tender, 3 to 4 minutes.
Directions.3: Increase heat to high. Stir in beans, broth, and pork, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 40 minutes. Add cheese and lime juice, and stir until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

32.Title: Loaded Potato Soup

Directions.1: Pierce potatoes with a fork. Microwave at HIGH 13 minutes or until tender. Cut in half; cool slightly.
Directions.2: Sauté onion in hot oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat 3 minutes. Add broth. Combine flour and 1/2 cup milk; stir into broth. Stir in remaining 1 1/2 cup milk. Bring to a boil, stirring often. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat; stir in sour cream, salt, and pepper.
Directions.3: Place bacon in a single layer on a paper towel-lined microwave-safe plate. Cover with a paper towel; microwave at HIGH 4 minutes. Crumble bacon.
Directions.4: Peel potatoes; discard potato skins. Coarsely mash potatoes into soup. Top with cheese, green onions, and bacon.

32.comments: Made 1-13-15. Good method for lower fat white sauce.

33.Title: Janet's Sausage Stars
33.Description: Janet Bartels made these tasty appetizers for a surprise birthday party for Shelly and me a few years ago (we are both April birthday girls), and I have been getting cravings for them ever since.

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 350°. Cook sausage and drain thoroughly.
Directions.2: Combine drained sausage with cheeses, olives, dressing, and red pepper.
Directions.3: Lightly grease muffin tins.
Directions.4: Press one won ton in each cup and bake 5 minutes.
Directions.5: Remove from tins and place on baking sheet. Fill each won ton with sausage mixture.
Directions.6: Bake an additional 5-8 minutes until cheese is bubbly.

Directions.1: Brown hamburger. Add diced onions and cook until onions are transparent. Drain grease.
Directions.2: Stir in remaining ingredients & simmer.

Directions.1: Slice steak into strips 1/4" wide and about 1" thick.
Directions.2: Mix together first 7 ingredients.
Directions.3: Add meat; stir to coat.
Directions.4: Let stand 2 hrs. at room temperature.
Directions.5: Lace meat accordion style on skewers.
Directions.6: Alternate with pineapple.
Directions.7: Tip each end with water chestnut.
Directions.8: Broil over hot coals 10 - 12 min; turn often and baste with marinade.

Directions.1: Combine flour, cocoa, salt, sugar, baking soda and baking powder in a bowl.
Directions.2: In another bowl combine mashed banana, oil and egg.
Directions.3: Stir wet ingredients along with chocolate chips into dry ingredients.
Directions.4: Blend until moistened.
Directions.5: Fill greased muffin tins or paper cup pans 3/4 full.
Directions.6: Bake at 350 for 20 min.

Directions.1: Combine flour, sugar, soda, cinnamon, and salt. Stir in carrots, raisins, coconut, and pecans.
Directions.2: In another bowl combine eggs, oil, apple, and vanilla. Add to flour mixture.
Directions.3: Stir only until combined. Spoon into greased muffin tins.
Directions.4: Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 18 minutes.

Directions.1: Puree bananas (1 c.).
Directions.2: Mix first 5 ingredients.
Directions.3: Combine dry ingredients.
Directions.4: Stir banana mixture into flour mixture until evenly moistened.
Directions.5: Spoon into greased muffin cups.
Directions.6: Bake at 375 degrees for 20 min.

Directions.1: Combine flour, 7 teaspoons sugar, orange peel, baking powder, salt and baking soda.
Directions.2: Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbles.
Directions.3: In a small bowl, combine cranberries, orange juice, cream and egg.
Directions.4: Add to flour mixture and stir until a soft dough.
Directions.5: Knead. Pat dough into 8-inch circle.
Directions.6: Cut into 10 wedges.
Directions.7: Separate and place on an ungreased baking sheet.
Directions.8: Brush with milk; sprinkle with remaining sugar.
Directions.9: Bake at 400 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes.
Directions.10: Combine powdered sugar and enough orange juice to make a glaze that will drizzle over warm scones.

4.Title: Potato Gratin with Mushrooms, Onions and Cereal Crunch

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with butter.
Directions.2: Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms, onion and garlic. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Directions.3: Arrange a layer of potato slices in the prepared baking dish, overlapping slices. Season with salt and pepper.
Directions.4: Top with the mushroom mixture, then sprinkle with thyme, Gruyà¨re and Parmesan.
Directions.5: Repeat layering until ingredients are used up, ending with a potato layer.
Directions.6: Pour the heavy cream evenly over the top. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 45 minutes.
Directions.7: Meanwhile, make the cereal crunch topping. Combine panko, 2 tablespoons melted butter, crushed corn flakes and 1 teaspoon thyme.
Directions.8: Uncover the gratin and sprinkle cereal crunch topping evenly over the top.
Directions.9: Broil for 2-3 minutes until browned and crispy on top.
Directions.10: Let rest 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with extra thyme.

Directions.1: Heat olive oil in stock pot, add cumin seed, fresh ginger, garlic, and turmeric (if using ground, wait to add along with other seasoning). This toasts the cumin seeds and brings out the aromatics of fresh ginger and turmeric.
Directions.2: After a minute add onions, celery, and bell pepper. Sauté until onions are translucent.
Directions.3: Add dry seasoning and sauté another minute, keep stirring or you could possibly burn your seasoning.
Directions.4: Add meat, squash, diced tomatoes and stock. Bring to a boil and simmer until butternut squash is tender, add the remaining vegetables, except kale and cilantro, and simmer another 10 minutes.
Directions.5: Salt and pepper to taste.
Directions.6: Add the kale, lemon juice, and cilantro only moments before serving, keeping your ingredients nice and bright! Serve and enjoy!

41.Title: Spicy Sausage-and-Chickpea Soup with Garlic Oil
41.Description: Spicy Italian pork sausage gives this soup a kick, but you can also substitute sweet Italian sausage.

Directions.1: Cook oil and garlic in a large saucepan over medium until garlic begins to brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove and discard garlic; reserve 3 tablespoons of the garlic oil.
Directions.2: Increase heat to medium-high. Add sausage to pan; cook, stirring often, until browned and crumbled, about 6 minutes. Remove sausage from pan; drain on paper towels.
Directions.3: Add onion, celery, and carrots to pan; cook, stirring occasionally, until slightly tender, about 4 minutes.
Directions.4: Stir in broth, tomatoes, chickpeas, and pepper; stir in sausage. Bring to a simmer; reduce heat to medium-low, and cook 20 minutes.
Directions.5: Stir in kale; cook until wilted, about 5 minutes.
Directions.6: Drizzle each serving with 1/2 tablespoon reserved garlic oil.

42.Title: Wild Rice Pilaf

Directions.1: Bring 2 1/4 cup water and salt to a boil in medium-size saucepan with tight-fitting lid.
Directions.2: Rinse rice in large strainer under hot water.
Directions.3: Add rice to boiling water, stir, and cover. Return water to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 35 to 40 minutes.
Directions.4: Meanwhile, wash celery, dry with paper towel, trim, and peel; slice thinly to measure about 1/2 cup. Wipe mushrooms with damp paper towels and slice thinly to measure about 1 1/2 cup. Peel onion and chop to measure 1/4 cup.
Directions.5: Melt butter in large skillet and sauté vegetables over medium-high heat until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Set aside.
Directions.6: When rice is done, toss with vegetables in skillet and sauté 2 to 3 minutes. Season pilaf with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

42.Comments: You can substitute brown rice here, but follow package directionsâ€”cooking time and amount of water required differ from wild rice.

43.Title: Vegetable Beef Soup

Directions.1: In a large kettle, brown onion in butter, add meat and brown.
Directions.2: Then add: and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Directions.3: Discard bones and fat.
Directions.4: Add and simmer 15 minutes, or until vegetables are done.

Description: To make more soup, add 4 more cups hot water and 4 more bouillon cubes to recipe.
Double recipe fills 5 qt pot to 3/4" from top.

44.Title: Chocolate Cranberry Phyllo Cups
44.description: Dipped and drizzled in chocolate, these mini Chocolate Cranberry Phyllo Cups are easy to make and even easier to devour! These pint-sized no-bake phyllo cups are perfect for the holidays!
44.author: Jenn Laughlin-Peas and Crayons

Directions.1: Place your dark chocolate and coconut oil in a small microwave-safe ramekin.
Directions.2: Melt via microwave by adjusting the power to 50% and heating at 30 second intervals, stirring in between each. It only took two 30 second cycles to melt mine but may vary depending on chocolate type and oven wattage. You can also melt chocolate stove-top using the double broiler method.
Directions.3: Dip a phyllo cup face-down in the chocolate until the edges are coated, almost like you're rimming a margarita glass with salt. My dish was shallow enough for me to drop the entire phyllo cup into the bowl then I simply inserted a toothpick into the middle of the phyllo cup to remove it and placed it chocolate side up on a plate. It sounds weird when typed out but the execution itself was super easy and took no time at all.
Directions.4: Once each cup is dipped in delicious chocolate, allow them to cool/dry on the countertop or pop them in the fridge to chill.
Directions.5: Once your chocolate has set, fill each phyllo cup to the brim with cranberries, pistachios and pecans.
Directions.6: Pour a little honey into each cup, add a little- or a lot! No need to worry about measurements.
Directions.7: Next melt your white chocolate and coconut oil using the same method as the chocolate above.
Directions.8: Stir chocolate with a fork then drizzle over each phyllo cup.
Directions.9: Allow chocolate to cool and dig in!

44.Description: Have a few extra minutes? You can toast your pistachios and pecans on a skillet with a little brown sugar and butter for an added level of deliciousness! I do this with my coconut baklava bites and it's ahhh-mazing! Making this ahead of time? It works marvelously! I dipped my phyllo shells in advance and stored them in an airtight container in the fridge overnight. I combined the chopped nuts and cranberry in a small container on the counter and simply assembled with the honey and white chocolate before serving, though you can fully assemble the entire thing and refrigerate as well!

45.Title: Truly Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup

Directions.1: Add butter, diced celery and carrots to a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Saute for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another 30 seconds.
Directions.2: Add chicken stock and season the broth with rosemary, sage, crushed red pepper, and salt. Taste and add a spoonful of 'better than bullion' chicken or chicken bouillon cubes or granules as needed.
Directions.3: Bring broth to a boil. Add noodles (either uncooked homemade egg noodles, or dry store-bought pasta) and cook just until noodles are al dente.
Directions.4: If using store-bought noodles, be cautious not to overcook them! Remove pot from heat as soon as they are just barely tender.
Directions.5: Add chicken meat from the rotisserie chicken. Taste the broth again and add more seasonings, if needed.
Directions.6: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 4-5 days, depending on the freshness of the chicken you used.
Directions.7: If using store-bought broth, add Better than Bullion chicken base for more depth of flavor.
Directions.8: Use a rotisserie chicken or whole roasted chicken for the meat and bones to make homemade chicken stock.
Directions.9: To use raw chicken meat, add raw chicken thighs, breasts, or tenders to the boiling broth in step 3 (before adding the noodles). Cook for about 5 minutes before adding the noodles.
Directions.10: For gluten-free adaptations, use gluten-free egg noodles or homemade egg noodles with gluten-free all-purpose flour.
Directions.11: Make ahead: Prepare the soup ahead of time using homemade egg noodles to prevent sogginess. If using dry noodles, make the broth first, then boil the broth and noodles and add the chicken on the day of serving.
Directions.12: Freezing Instructions: Cool the soup completely and store in a freezer-safe container for 2-3 months. Thaw overnight in the fridge or over medium heat on the stove. If using store-bought noodles, undercook them before freezing to avoid sogginess upon reheating.

45.Description: A homemade chicken noodle soup made with rotisserie chicken and seasoned broth. Perfect for a cozy meal. Highly recommended to use homemade stock for best flavor. Includes options for gluten-free adaptations and make-ahead instructions. Perfect for freezing and reheating.

46.Title: Mediterranean Bowl

Directions.1: Measure cooked brown rice and place into a medium to large size bowl.
Directions.2: If rice is not cooked, cook according to package directions.
Directions.3: Wash and chop spinach, broccoli, and cherry tomatoes. Chop or slice vegetables to your preference. Place on top of brown rice.
Directions.4: Drain and rinse a can of garbanzo beans. Place 1/2 cup on top of brown rice and vegetables.
Directions.5: In a small bowl, combine vinaigrette ingredients. Whisk together with a fork.
Directions.6: Drizzle all over brown rice, vegetables, and beans.
Directions.7: To combine: Add lemon slices as garnish (optional).

46.Description: The Mediterranean Bowl is perfect for meal prep. Utilize already-cooked brown rice to throw this lunch or dinner together quickly. Make extra dressing and store it in the fridge for next time. Use leftover vegetables, chicken, pork, or other protein.

5.Title: Mushroom and Cauliflower Rice Soup with Chicken
5.Description: This veggie-filled soup from The Paleo Gut Healing Cookbook features immune-boosting cauliflower (an excellent source of vitamin C), sweet potatoes (rich in beta carotene) and mushrooms (which are anti-inflammatory and act as a prebiotic).

Directions.1: Add the sweet potato to a pot with 2 cups of water. Boil for 10-12 minutes, until fork-tender. Drain and add to a blender with 1-2 cups water to form a cream sauce. You want a loose puree, similar to the consistency of soup. It should yield 2 cups; adjust water as needed.
Directions.2: To a large stockpot, add the oil over medium heat. Once shimmering, add carrots, celery, mushrooms and onion. Stir for 5-6 minutes, until the onion and mushrooms are softened. Stir in garlic for 30 seconds.
Directions.3: Pour the broth on top of vegetables and add all seasonings. Simmer for 10-12 minutes, until veggies are tender.
Directions.4: Add the shredded chicken and cauliflower rice. Stir to combine. Add the 2 cups of potato puree and stir well. Remove from heat and serve.

5.source: Recipe from The Paleo Gut Healing Cookbook. © 2021 Quarto Publishing Group USA Inc. Text © 2021 Alison Marras

6.Title: Slow-Cooked Sauerkraut Soup
6.Description: We live in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania, which has a rich heritage of German culture and dishes that include sauerkraut, potatoes and sausage. We enjoy this recipe on cold winter evenings, along with muffins and fruit. The 'mmm's' start with the first whiff as the door opens after school or work. —Linda Lohr, Lititz, Pennsylvania

Directions.1: In a 5-qt. slow cooker, combine the first 12 ingredients. Cover and cook on high for 5-6 hours or until the vegetables are tender. Skim fat.
Directions.2: Garnish with bacon.

Directions.1: Brown the beef with the garlic in a large pot over medium-high heat. Drain off excess fat. Add tomato sauce, Ro-Tel, salt, oregano, cumin, and chili powder. Stir, cover the pot, and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Directions.2: Add the beans. Stir to combine, then cover and simmer for another 20 minutes.
Directions.3: Mix the masa with the warm water and stir to form a paste. Add to chili and stir to combine. Simmer to thicken for 10 minutes.
Directions.4: Serve with sour cream, chopped onion, grated cheese, cilantro, and corn chips on the side.

8.Title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts & Quinoa with Warm Red Onion Vinaigrette
8.author: JUDY KIM

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 450° and line a half sheet pan with parchment paper. Spread Brussels sprouts over pan, drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Mix well and roast, 10 minutes.
Directions.2: Meanwhile, prepare quinoa according to package instructions and drain any excess liquid. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil and mix to coat evenly. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, toast quinoa until crispy (use a wooden spoon to scrape the bottom of the pan if quinoa begins to stick), then transfer to a large bowl.
Directions.3: Return skillet to medium heat and add remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, red onion, and garlic, and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, then whisk in vinegar and mustard. Keep warm until ready to serve.
Directions.4: Add parsley, Brussels sprouts, and vinaigrette to quinoa. Mix well and serve.

Directions.1: Saute onions in butter.
Directions.2: Add chicken broth, celery, carrots, Tobasco Sauce & simmer 30 mins.
Directions.3: Add potato soup, cheese & sour cream. Simmer 15 minutes.

47.Title: Beef-and-Butternut Squash Chili

Directions.1: Cook beef, bell pepper, and next 2 ingredients in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat until meat crumbles and is no longer pink. Drain well, and return to Dutch oven.
Directions.2: Stir in tomatoes and next 5 ingredients; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, 15 minutes.
Directions.3: Stir in corn, and cook, uncovered, 15 minutes or until squash is tender and chili is thickened.

47.Description: We've loaded this chili with beef and beans for zinc and B vitamins, tomatoes and green peppers for vitamin C, and butternut squash for beta-carotene.

48.Title: Stuffed Acorn Squash

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Directions.2: Place the squash halves cut side down in a baking dish. Add water to the dish.
Directions.3: Bake for 30 minutes or until tender.
Directions.4: In a skillet, cook the beef, onion, and celery over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Directions.5: Stir in the flour, salt, and sage until blended.
Directions.6: Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
Directions.7: Remove from the heat; stir in rice and cheese.
Directions.8: Turn squash cut side up; fill with meat mixture.
Directions.9: Bake, uncovered, for 20-25 minutes or until heated through.

48.Description: This stuffed acorn squash recipe has everything: a savory meat and rice filling, melted cheese on top and an edible vessel (the squash). It's a perfectly cozy meal for colder months.

49.Title: Curried Yellow Lentil Stew

Directions.1: Place all ingredients into a large pot. Stir well and bring to simmer.
Directions.2: Cook for 35 to 40 minutes until all vegetables are tender. Adjust seasonings as needed.

49.Description: A hearty and flavorful stew featuring yellow lentils and a variety of vegetables, seasoned with curry spices. Perfect for a nutritious meal.

50.Title: Three Bean Chili in a Jar

Directions.1: In an 8- or 12-ounce jar or clear, food-safe bag, layer the black beans, kidney beans, and pinto beans, pressing gently to ensure defined, colorful layers.
Directions.2: In a small bowl, mix remaining ingredients. Seal in a small bag and place with spice blend on top of the beans.
Directions.3: Securely close the jar or bag and attach a decorative ribbon and tag with cooking directions.
Directions.4: Rinse beans and drain in a colander. Add beans to a large stockpot, cover with two inches of water, and soak beans overnight (or, to quick-soak: bring to a boil, cover, and continue to boil for 5 minutes. Turn off heat, and let beans soak about two hours).
Directions.5: Drain and rinse beans and return to the stockpot.
Directions.6: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in the stockpot. Sauté 1 medium chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves.
Directions.7: Add the beans and spice mix, 1 14-ounce can diced tomatoes with liquid, and enough water or broth to cover (about 4 to 6 cups). Simmer until the beans are tender, about 30 minutes.

50.Description: Enjoy this hearty one-pot meal to warm body and soul on a chilly winter evening. Enjoy on its own or with cornbread and a simple salad.
